title: Bug 121974: Can't evaluate global expressions when ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop
description: Bug 121974: Can't evaluate global expressions when ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop. For global expressions, such as {params['p1']}, {new DateTime()}, they should always be available and evaluatable within the BIRT scripting environment. Currently, Dte scriptExpression has three types: BEFOREFIRSTROW, AFTERLASTROW, and ONEACHROW.
OB: When trying to evaluate global expressions that are not in the iteration loop, a 'QueryResults or its iterator has been closed' DataException is thrown.
EB: Global expressions, such as {params['p1']}, {new DateTime()}, should be valid and evaluable even when ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop. They should not throw a 'QueryResults or its iterator has been closed' DataException.
SR: To reproduce the issue, try to evaluate global expressions, such as {params['p1']}, {new DateTime()}, outside of the iteration loop and observe the 'QueryResults or its iterator has been closed' DataException that is thrown.
